text: Let the beauty of what you love be what you do.
author: Rumi

text: School bells are ringing loud and clear; vacation's over, school is here.
author: Winifred C. Marshall

text: Transitions are almost always signs of growth, but they can bring feelings of loss. To get somewhere new, we may have to leave somewhere else behind.
author: Fred Rogers

text: Of all the paths you take in life, make some lead to the lake.
I was rich, if not in money, in sunny hours and summer days.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: I'm a greater believer in luck, and I find the harder I work the more I have of it.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: It is life, I think, to watch the water. A man can learn so many things.
author: Nicholas Sparks

text: Ah, summer, what power you have to make us suffer and like it.
author: Russell Baker

text: Those who deny freedom to others, deserve it not for themselves.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Travel and change of place impart new vigor to the mind.
author: Seneca

text: Good news is rare these days, and every glittering ounce of it should be cherished and hoarded and worshipped and fondled like a priceless diamond.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

text: I wonder what it would be like to live in a world where it was always June.
author: L.M. Montgomery

text: Freedom makes a huge requirement of every human being. With freedom comes responsibility.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: Starting strong is good. Finishing strong is epic.
author: Robin Sharma

text: Be like a flower and turn your face to the sun.
author: Khalil Gibran

text: Collect Moments, Not Things.
The bad news is time flies. The good news is you're the pilot.
author: Michael Altshuler

text: Spring is the time of plans and projects.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: Fight for the things that you care about, but do it in a way that will lead others to join you.
author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg

text: Never feel sorry for raising dragon slayers in a time when there are actual dragons.
author: Unknown

text: It is in your moments of decision that your destiny is shaped.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Change will not come if we wait for some other person or some other time. We are the ones we've been waiting for. We are the change that we seek.
author: Barack Obama

text: February is an uncertain month, filled with the flavor of anticipation.
author: Gladys Taber

text: I can be changed by what happens to me. But I refuse to be reduced by it.
author: Maya Angelou

text: It is always the right time to do the right thing.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Feeling a little blue in January is normal.
author: Marilu Henner

text: Perfectionism is the enemy of progress.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
author: Sam Levenson

text: Chill December brings the sleet, Blazing fire and Christmas Treat.
author: Sara Coleridge

text: Christmas, children, is not a date. It is a state of mind.
author: Mary Ellen Chase

text: Health is not valued till sickness comes.
author: Thomas Fuller

text: Little by little, one travels far
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: I wanted freedom, open air and adventure. I found it on the sea.
author: Alain Gerbault

text: Do not be angry with the rain; it simply does not know how to fall upwards.
author: Vladimir Nabokov

text: In November you begin to know how long the winter will be.
author: Martha Gellhorn

text: What's your favorite scary movie?
author: Ghostface

text: Big pay and little responsibility are circumstances seldom found together.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: How bravely Autumn paints upon the sky the gorgeous fame of summer which is fled!
author: Thomas Hood

text: The difference between ordinary and extraordinary is practice.
author: Vladimir Horowitz

text: Give the one you love wings to fly, roots to come back and reasons to stay.
author: The Dalai Lama

text: Autumn Mornings sunshine and crisp air, birds and calmness, year's end and day's beginning.
author: Terri Guillemets

text: Home is where one starts from.
author: T.S. Eliot

text: The morning had dawned clear and cold, with a crispness that hinted at the end of summer.
author: George R. R. Martin

text: Start where you are. Use what You have. Do what you Can.
author: Arthur Ashe

text: But the thing about thunderstorms is that there is a sense of peace When once the storm is over.
author: Tabitha Kelly

text: Not many people have had as much bad luck as I have, but not many people have had as much good luck, either.
author: Tig Notaro

text: With each new day, we discover some thing extraordinary at summer camp.
author: Unknown

text: Where could one settle more pleasantly than in one's home?
author: Cicero

text: Let freedom never perish in your hands.
author: Joseph Addison

text: The world is a bock, and those who do not travel read only one page.
author: Unknown

text: It's summer and time for wandering...
author: Kellie Elmore

text: It is life, I think, to watch the water. A man can learn s0 many things.
author: Nicholas Sparks

text: Deep summer is when laziness finds respectability.
author: Sam Keen

text: Wherever you fly, you'll be the best of the best. Wherever you go, you will top all the rest.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: Freedom is nothing but a chance to be better.
author: Albert Camus

text: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: It's not about who you are today, it's about who you want to become and the price you are willing to pay to get there.
author: Tom Bilyeu

text: You will never look back on life and think, "I spent too much time with my kids."
author: Unknown

text: When in doubt, overdress.
author: Vivienne Westwood

text: April hath put a spirit of youth in everything.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Take care of your body. It's the only place you have to live in.
author: Jim Rohn

text: For most of history, Anonymous was a woman.
author: Virginia Woolf

text: While it is February, one can taste the full joys of anticipation. Spring stands at the gate with her finger on the latch.
author: Patience Strong

text: And if the stars should ever die, we'll make our own light, you and I.
author: John Mark Green

text: Start where you are, with what you have. Make Something of it and never be satisfied.
author: George Washington Carver

text: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Some days are like that. Even in Australia.
author: Judith Viorst

text: Darkness Cannot drive Out darkness. Only light can do that. Hate Cannot drive out hate. Only LOVE can do that.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: And now welcome the new year. Full of of things that have never been.
author: Rainer Marie Rilke

text: A holiday is on opportunity to journey Within.
author: Prabhas

text: December is a time to reflect on the blessings of the past year and to embrace the opportunities of the coming one.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Today or any day that phone may ring and bring good news.
author: Ethel Waters

text: When I started counting my blessings my whole life turned around.
author: Willie Nelson

text: Love the trees until their leaves fall off, then encourage them to try again next year.
author: Chad Sugg

text: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.
author: Alan Watts

text: Always thrown spilled salt over your left shoulder. Keep rosemary buy your garden gate. Plant lavender for luck and fall in love whenever you can.
author: Sally Owen, Practical Magic

text: Autumn is a second spring when every leaf is a flower.
author: Albert Camus

text: Enjoy the present hour, be thankful for the past, And neither fear, nor wish the approaches of the last.
author: Abraham Cowley

text: No matter what happens, travel gives you a story to tell.
author: Jewish Proverb

text: If there ever comes a day we can't be together - hold me in your heart I'll Stay there forever!
author: Winnie
